item.title: New firstboot option in snap guest
item.description: Snap-guest is a simple script for creating copy-on-write QEMU/KVM guests. I have added new option “-1 [command]” that will execute a script during first boot. It uses rc.local file, so it should be compatible with most distributions. I test on RHEL and Fedoras. Primary reason is I maintain some auto-install scripts in git, so I usually do something like: ./snap-guest -b fedora-17-base -t test-vm -s 4098 -1 "git clone xyz && \ cd xyz && bash -x script.
